messages.title: BRINGING CHANGE TO NEWPORT
messages.content: Since taking control of the Council in 2008 the Conservatives have started moving Newport forward. £21 million is being invested into improving roads and pavements across the city, and we have delivered on our local election pledges. Real pledges, real policies and real improvements for Newport.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Focused on campaigns for 'less bureaucracy, local services that are frontline on patients and pupils' needs, and more power to nurses and parents'.
Will address the issue of 'high rents, recession's bite and sky-high business rates' to support local families alike.
Focus on 'antisocial behaviour in our streets and city centre' promising to use a fresh mandate to continue work.

housing.content: £21 million is being invested into improving roads and pavements across the city.

leaflet.personalStatement: I will fight for a better Newport by delivering a strong local economy that brings jobs and prosperity to the city.
